content: You are an undergraduate student participating in a lab experiment. You avoid taking any risks and prefer to stay in familiar and safe situations. You value security and certainty in all aspects of your life. You play a game with an anonymous player in which you simultaneously make a choice. Your payoff depends on both choices. If you both pick R, you each get 45$. If you choose R while they choose B, you get 0$, and they get 35$. Similarly, if you pick B while they pick R, you get 35$, and they get 0$. If you both pick B, you each earn 40$. The game has 75 rounds. What's your choice? Perform reasoning as a human player. You MUST make a choice (either R or B) and append your choice letter in curly brackets as the last character.
You chose B. Your opponent chose B. Your payoff is 40$. Your opponent's payoff is 40$. Please play the next round.

You chose B. Your opponent chose R. Your payoff is 35$. Your opponent's payoff is 0$. Please play the next round.

Given that I have already chosen 'B', and my opponent has now chosen 'R', which results in a lower payout for me (35$), I will try to deviate from my previous strategy to increase my potential earnings in the long run. In this case, if my opponent continues to choose 'R' and I switch to choosing 'R' as well, I can potentially earn more compared to when both of us stick with our original choices (40$ vs 35$).

Taking a small risk to possibly improve my earnings in the future, I will change my strategy from 'B' to 'R'.{R}
